Risk Description: SIEM logs may capture unnecessary personal data
Mitigation Strategy: Reduce log verbosity, apply masking, retention limits

Risk Description: Improper access control may expose sensitive incident data
False positives may cause unnecessary investigations
Network monitoring may reveal employee behaviour patterns
Mitigation Strategy: Minimise behavioural analytics, enforce strict access controls

Risk Description: Over-monitoring may result in perceived surveillance
Analysts may misinterpret alerts and escalate incorrectly
Mitigation Strategy: Training, review process, dual-analysis for high-impact alerts

Risk Description: Wearables may incorrectly predict health emergencies
Mitigation Strategy: Medical review, improve thresholds, expand test datasets

Risk Description: Location data collected without user awareness
Mitigation Strategy: Add explicit consent flow, reduce telemetry

Risk Description: Data sent to cloud may expose sensitive metrics
Mitigation Strategy: Encrypt in transit/at rest, minimise fields

Risk Description: Training data may introduce bias into predictions
Model decisions may be opaque or difficult to explain
Model may be misused outside intended purpose
Device telemetry may leak sensitive data
Firmware updates may fail and brick devices
Devices may track users without explicit consent
Data warehouse stores unnecessary identifiers
Pipelines may re-identify users when datasets combine
Lack of lineage may cause misuse of historical data
API responses may expose unnecessary user data
Poor consent UI may mislead users
Auth flow may leak info via error messaging
CV system may misidentify athletes
Camera feeds may capture bystanders
Tracking may be repurposed for surveillance
Misconfigured S3 buckets, databases, or IAM policies may expose sensitive fitness/health data to public access
Mitigation Strategy: Infrastructure-as-Code reviews, automated config scanning (AWS Config/Security Hub), least privilege IAM policies, regular cloud security audits

Risk Description: Ransomware attack may encrypt critical systems, wearable device infrastructure, and customer data, halting operations
Former employees, contractors, or unused service accounts may retain access to systems containing sensitive user data
Mitigation Strategy: Automated deprovisioning workflows, quarterly access reviews, identity lifecycle management, least privilege enforcement, privileged access monitoring

Risk Description: Fitness/health data processing may violate GDPR, Australian Privacy Act, or other regulations due to inadequate consent, retention, or security controls
Mitigation Strategy: Conduct Privacy Impact Assessments (PIAs), appoint Data Protection Officer, implement data subject rights workflows, document legal basis for processing, regular compliance audits

Risk Description: SQL injection, XSS, or API injection flaws in web dashboards or mobile apps may allow unauthorized data access or system compromise
Mitigation Strategy: Input validation and sanitization, parameterized queries, security testing in CI/CD pipeline (SAST/DAST), OWASP Top 10 training for developers, Web Application Firewall (WAF)
